name: Spanish Pimento Cheese Spread
description: Ken Oringer, a chef and owner of Toro, serves this spread with chicken-skin "crackers" for little sandwiches he calls bocadillas.
recipeIngredient: 4 ounces Spanish Tetilla cheese, or ripe Italian fontina, rinds removed
2 ounces Caña de Cabra or other soft goat cheese
3 tablespoons finely chopped, drained piquillo peppers
Salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Mash the cheeses together until smooth. Work in the paprikas, hot sauce, lemon zest and juice and Worcestershire sauce. Fold in piquillo peppers and scallions. Season with salt and pepper.
Store in refrigerator until ready to use. Spread will keep up to two days.
